definition: bit by bit/every little bit
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
a drop/to drip

sentences.english: The collective wealth has been accumulated bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 集体的家业是一点一滴地积攒起来的。

sentences.english: A child assimilates it only gradually .
sentences.chinese: 儿童只能一点一滴地掌握它。

sentences.english: One day it will anew exhumed bit minted into good.
sentences.chinese: 总有一天会从新挖掘出来一点一滴铸造成美好。

sentences.english: Progress of a student should be largely attributed to his teachers' direction and enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 孩子一点一滴的进步主要来自于老师们的指导和点拨。

sentences.english: Taxes were collected in dribs and drabs.
sentences.chinese: 税是一点一滴收集起来的。

sentences.english: In dribs and drabs , parts of the appliance came together.
sentences.chinese: 一点一滴地，这个装置的几个部分终于成形了。

sentences.english: My knowledge all came in drips and drabs after I got there.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是来港后一点一滴逐渐认识的。

sentences.english: Sometimes it’s nice to enjoy each morsel of life as it comes.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，慢慢的享受生活的一点一滴是很幸福的。

sentences.english: The time is sneaking off, Bit by bit, does not have the sound.
sentences.chinese: 时间在溜走，一点一滴，没有声息。

sentences.english: Big success comes from small, consistent changes.
sentences.chinese: 积土成山，成功来自于一点一滴，坚持就会改变。

definition: little by little/bit by bit/gradually
bit by bit/dribs and drabs/the little details/every aspect
a drip/a little bit/intravenous drip (used to administer drugs)
to accumulate over a long period of time
a little bit
(of time) to pass/to elapse
for years/over the years
slowly
imperceptible influence/to influence secretly
one step, one footprint (idiom); steady progress/reliable
pinyin: yi1 bu4 yi1 ge4 jiao3 yin4

definition: Many little things add up to sth great./Many little drops make an ocean. (idiom)
year in, year out (idiom)/(over) many years
many hairs make a fur coat (idiom); many small contributions add up to sth big/many a mickle makes a muckle
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
sand grains accumulate to make a tower a tower (idiom); by gathering small amounts one gets a huge quantity/many a mickle makes a muckle
dripping water penetrates the stone (idiom); constant perseverance yields success/You can achieve your aim if you try hard without giving up./Persistent effort overcomes any difficulty.
